channel.title: Market Transparency on Democratize Data For Insights
channel.description: Recent content in Market Transparency on Democratize Data For Insights

item.title: Collect Daily Level Short Sale Data From FINRA With Low Costs and Low Delay
item.description: Short Sale Data Matters Short selling, by definition, occurs when an investor borrows a security and sells it on the open market, planning to buy it back later for less money. Short-sellers bet on, and profit from, a drop in a security’s price. Being timely informed about equities’ short-selling status is of interests to broad market participants. For investors, short-selling is a power signal indicating the existed or, sometimes, upcoming market sentiment, both matter a lot when making the trading decisions.
